thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits Hector Bellerin faces late fitness test ahead of Arsenal clash against Hull
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits Hector Bellerin faces late fitness test ahead of Arsenal clash against Hull

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Arsene Wenger admits Hector Bellerin faces late fitness test ahead of Arsenal clash against Hull
text:
Arsene Wenger admits Hector Bellerin faces late fitness test ahead of Arsenal clash against Hull The Spaniard suffered a concussion on Saturday after a coming together with Chelsea's Marcos Alonso Share   Wenger delivers Arsenal's team news ahead of clash with Hull Share this video Get   Thank you for subscribing! Could   revealed that Hector Bellerin will undergo a late fitness test ahead of Arsenal 's Saturday lunchtime kick off against Hull. 
The speedy right-back, who recently committed his future to the club, suffered a concussion on Saturday after a coming together with countryman Marcos Alonso. 
Bellerin caught an elbow to the face as the Chelsea left-wing-back scored, and fell flat on his back. According to Wenger, the 21-year-old was unable to recall what the score was after regaining consciousness. Read More Arsene Wenger calls for unity amid fan unrest Chelsea's Spanish defender Marcos Alonso (L) rises above Arsenal's Spanish defender Hector Bellerin (C) to score the opening goal (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Reports suggested midweek that Bellerin may well be ready to return to action on Saturday, despite FA guidelines suggesting that concussed players should not play for 14 days after a serious head injury. 
However, in his pre-match press conference, Wenger said: "Hector is going through tests every day. Bellerin receives treatment after his blow to the head (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
"We will only know tomorrow if he gets the green light." 
Meanwhile, Wenger did have some good news over Egypt's AFCON star Mohamed Elneny, he said: "Elneny is back available and apart from that we have a question about Bellerin. 
Arsenal enter the clash having lost their previous two Premier League games, that damaging 3-1 defeat to Chelsea last weekend being one of those. Like us on Facebook
